intro: Allosanthus, commonly known as the sweet sarsaparilla, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and palmate leaves that are often hairy. The flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically greenish or reddish in color. Allosanthus species are native to temperate regions of the Americas, particularly South America. They are often grown for their ornamental value and have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
